alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 4:18PM EDT until August 06 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL MCCREARY, SOUTH CENTRAL PULASKI AND NORTHEASTERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heaviest rainfall had ended across the area; however, excessive runoff from previous heavy rainfall will continue to cause localized flash flooding of small creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monticello, Burnside, Kidder, Delta, Quinton, Betsey, General Burnside S.P., Tateville, Steubenville, Sloans Valley and Alpine. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
